content.description: Start in the crack directly below the tree.  Follow the crack up to the tree and continue to the roof.  The crack gets much larger above the tree and it may be easier to make a short belay from the tree first.  When you get to the roof, the route traverses to the right until you get to some large boulders that can be down climbed on the far side of the gully.  There is a crack along the traverse that makes it easily protected.
content.protection: Standard rack up to #4 Friend and several more hand size pieces.

content.description: I did this route on an ascender, thought it was going to be another 5.9 chimney but got my a55 kicked. I was totally glad I did not try to lead this route, way hard for me at the time. There are bats in hand crack at the top.
content.protection: I didn't see much except at the top.
content.location: When viewed from the parking lot look above & past Little Twin Owls Finger Crack to formation with 2 cracks in an inset, this is the crack to the South. The crack to the North is Botany Crack, an easy 5.9.
